alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Monroe; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 03 at 4:54AM CDT until April 03 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL MONROE...NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND CENTRAL CLARKE COUNTIES... At 453 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Wagarville, or 8 miles west of Jackson, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Grove Hill, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy and Whatley. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
